CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 9, 1957, pg. C23 reads: "In Charity Game - The basketball team of the Greater Pittsburgh Elks 115 will take part in benefit twin bill scheduled for Baxter Junior High School Tuesday evening. Members of the Elks team, one of the best independent clubs in the area are, left to right, front row: Jim Robinson, Bobby Walden, Larry Wilson and Joe Bolden.  Back row: Honey Thompson, Charles Jones, Harry Edwards, coach; Ralph Echols and Hubert Kelly, assistant coach.  The games will be played for the benefit of the March of Dimes. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of the Greater Pittsburgh Elks 115 basketball team, front row, left to right: Jim Robinson, Bobby Walden, Larry Wilson, and Joe Bolden; back row, left to right: Honey Thompson, Charles Jones, Coach Harry Edwards, Ralph Echols, and Assistant Coach Hubert Kelly, posed in gymnasium
